column2: Momtomany, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I cannot use hormonal birth control and latex condoms. I  have been using VCF for several months. My husband And I am happy with it. Sometimes it's hard to get in and sometimes I need to add ky jelly due to vaginal dryness to make sure it desolves properly. It makes oral unpleasant so that's out when in use. It's cheap and easy best of all it works. I will keep using them as long as needed.

column2: netforyoutoknow, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Used it as directed - got pregnant.

column2: JeniB, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been using this product for 6 months with no problems. I tried Encare first and that burned my husband. Then I tried VCF and we love it. I had a problem at first with the film sticking to my finger, so I made sure my hands were dry and clean and folded the film again. Now I can insert the film like a pro, even in the dark. I will definately keep using this product. It's cheaper and safer than the pill.

column2: Bri95, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I tryed it for a while but didn't love it, of course i was using it with the pill I just wouldn't risk it without a backup 74% effectiveness isn't effective enough for me! In gonna stick to the pill and a condom much easier to use :)

column2: WPN, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It feels like you are not wearing anything. So far I haven't had any problems at all. I was excited to find something hormonal free and that it didn't irritate me.

column2: 25-34 Female  (Patient)

column2: bblang26, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Love this product!!!  I have been using this form of BC since I started having a period.  I tried other methods like the pill, IUD, and the ring. All have failed!  So I continure to come back to VCF film...its wonderful and very safe!!!  Thank god there is something effective other than sterilzation!  (and even that isnt 100%)

column2: Susie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've used this product for years...I har a 13 yr old, 11 yr old and 4 year old...I also have had 5 miscarriages so I know I get pregnant easily when not using broth control. I have no idea how someone can have this stuck to their finger and it not come off. Fold it in half again after opening, make sure your hands are dry and put in up all the way. Use your cervix to help you remove from finger. More simple than A condom. I'm flabbergasted that people can't do this. I've also just put it on my husband when he is erect and he did his thing. When he is up there, it has obviously dissolved. Burning? I'm sure some people may be sensitive, I'm sensitive to latex and have condom issues. This has never once given me an issue.the review about cramping and bleeding? Yeah, that's not from this. Probably just your period. Duh. This is the BEST contraceptive out there. I've tried them ALL! (the 4 year old was a foam baby...so yeah, that didn't work for me) this stuff is awesome. If you're not a complete moron, you can use this!

column2: LeighLeigh, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I love this product i use to get rashes from condoms and we tried pretty much every kind i found this not only is it easy to put in and affective but it makes sex more enjoyable have not had any bleeding cramps nothing that has been mentioned i guess its a trial and error some people can use it some cant

column2: ana, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had no problems putting the film in and no side effects other than not getting pregnant.  My husband prefers it to condoms and I prefer it over taking the pill.  I have used this product for about six months.

column2: ANNONYMOUS, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am totally flabberghasted to find that other women have had ill effects from using this method...I too wasted several films trying to insert and developed a serious infection...the antibiotics are not helping with the irritation that does not seem to be going away, and I would tell anyone thinking of using this method....DON'T !!!! I only hope the damage it's caused is not permanent...UNREAL!!!!

column2: Seaandra, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years
column9: We can never get one to stay in, stuck to my finger, my husband tried also thinking maybe a different angle would work...nothing. We have tried on many occasions, wasting a total of at least 10 of the films. I like the foam, ill just stick with  that, although we learned you have to fill the applicator in the light, sometimes it just fills with air, and thats how we have our 6 year old son (but its okay, we kinda like the kid now haha) FILM-absolutely NOT, but foam...when used properly is okay.

column2: justined0414, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: ggg, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: JESSBELL, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had used the product previously without any problems, we i stopped using it for a while since my boyfriend and I prefered using condoms. Yesterday we decided to use one of the films and it was horrible! All of a sudden I started bleeding!!! As soon as i took it out the bleeding stopped but I will never use this product again!!!!!!!!!

column2: Female
column9: This product did NOT satisfy me; in fact, it created several issues and it was extremely difficult to use. 1. Difficult to insert. It stuck to my hand while I attempted to insert it. I had to go through several films before I correctly inserted it. 2. I woke up the next day with a painful, itchy, yeast infection. This yeast infection lasted for over a week. 3. I developed abrasions on my vaginal walls because after it dissolved, it ruined the natural lubrication in my vagina. I still cannot have sex as it is too painful. I am waiting for the abrasions to heal. And NO, it is not herpes; I had them checked out by the doctor and they were simply abrasions on the walls of my vagina. 4. Overall I would NEVER EVER recommend that anyone use this! Anything but this product. VCF has caused me to stay abstinente for weeks now!

column2: HATEVCF, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had to go thru three films also, finally balling the film up and shoving it inside me and it still tred to stick to my finger. After 24 hours, I woke up with a HUGE rash on my abdomen that has been driving me crazy, have vaginal pain, and my breasts are irritated also.  I am having to use lotions creams and and benedryl to keep the itching and pain at a minimum.  WILL NEVER USE THIS PRODUCT AGAIN!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I'm assuming it was effective since I'm not pregnant, but this might be from the result of forced abstinence more than the spermacide. I threw the rest away and am switching to something else.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: Carolyn, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
